intro: Vellozia aequatorialis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian vellozia, is a unique flowering plant native to the Andes region of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Podostomataceae and is characterized by its specialized adaptations to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its elongated, ribbon-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
